activities.title: 3D Printing
activities.description: we will present the 3D Printing and 3D scanning activities in UoS.

activities.title: Sounds Good To Me!
activities.description: Experience the strange environments of an anechoic and a reverberation chamber. Have a play with some acoustic toys and see if you can understand how each produces sound.

activities.title: Cilia defend our lungs
activities.description: Live cilia demonstrated by microscopy & on screen; & cilia movie display

activities.title: Taking Technology Smaller
activities.description: A fun introduction to 'transistors', the key component in computer chips, and an exciting new way to make these even smaller so that technology such as computers, tablets and mobile phones can do even more.

activities.title: Nostalgia Den
activities.description: Feel the warm glow of your memory! Explore toys and music from different eras to let you grown up kids share the golden oldies of your youth with the whole family. Experience the power of nostalgia with your own fond memories.  Take a photo to capture your new memories of the day and bring it home with you!

activities.title: Hampshire & Isle of Wight Wildlife Trust
activities.description: As a conservation charity with nearly 50 nature reserves across Hampshire & the Isle of Wight, we provide information/displays about our Nature Reserves, local wildlife, wildlife gardening, marine projects, and information on how to get involved us and support us.

activities.title: Flat polymer loudspeaker
activities.description: A flat loudspeaker can be easily made by overlapping layers of rubber and perforated metal. An high voltage amplifier is needed to generate sound.

activities.title: Keeping caveman warm: turning animal furs into clothing
activities.description: For thousands of years, humans kept warm by dressing in the furs and hides of animals they had hunted. Come and learn how prehistoric people used science to solve this most basic of survival challenges during the last ice age.

activities.title: Prehistoric metallurgy: smelting bronze age weapons
activities.booking notes: Ongoing, but with actual casting events approximately once per hour
activities.description: This smelting demonstration will use a simple charcoal-fuelled firing pit and valveless skin-bag bellows to melt oxidised copper and tin minerals. Come and watch the molten metal being poured into stone casts for the manufacture of Bronze artefacts.

activities.title: Tools through time: 2 million years of technological innovation
activities.description: This event traces the origins of the axe through time from flint axes to Bronze age, Iron age, Viking and medieval examples. Come and handle the replicas and watch our flint knapping demonstrators as they manufacture a handaxe while you watch!

activities.title: Wearable e-textile for stroke rehabilitation
activities.description: Activities for children: brain colouring, brain anatomy, Activities for the adults: quiz, live demo for muscle stimulation, Activities for all: sample display (traditional hydrogel electrode vs. wearable fabric electrode), animation.

activities.title: The Wellbeing Sanctuary
activities.description: The wellbeing sanctuary will provide visitors with a set of interactive activities focused on positive lifestyle and behaviour change to promote physical and emotional wellbeing. The accompanying research from our group will also be showcased alongside the activities.

activities.title: Wildern School STEM fair Winner
activities.description: This will be the winners of the STEM fair presenting what they have designed to the general public, explaining its link to STEM

activities.title: Accelerate
activities.description: Explosive and electrifying show aimed at school children, all about particle physics: learn all about how to build a particle accelerator!

activities.title: Breathing Pattern Matters: a demonstration of new technology for measuring breathing
activities.description: We will be providing a demonstration of a new contactless breathing pattern measurement technology called ‘Structured Light Plethysmography’ (SLP), which measures breathing patterns by shining a light on the front of the chest. We plan to provide a demonstration of the technology and project a recording of the data onto a large screen to demonstrate some of the differences between normal and abnormal breathing patterns.

locations.title: Electronics
locations.description: Fibre-pulling towers clean room tour and more activities

locations.title: Physics
locations.description: Astrodome, Light Express, Accelerate! and the Science of Stephen Hawking

locations.title: Behind the Library
locations.description: Outside where temp bldg 22 used to be (behind library)
